byline.contributor: Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul.

abstract: One hundred thousand children are among 250,000 people caught in divided, war-torn Aleppo, most vulnerable victims of bombings by Syrian forces and Russian allies; underground shelters in eastern part of ravaged city offer no protection from bombs.

headline.print_headline: Children of Aleppo, Trapped in a Killing Zone
headline.main: Why So Many Children Are Being Killed in Aleppo

snippet: Among the roughly 250,000 people stuck in the insurgent redoubt in northern Syria are 100,000 children, the most vulnerable victims of intensified bombings....
lead_paragraph: Among the roughly 250,000 people stuck in the insurgent redoubt in northern Syria are 100,000 children, the most vulnerable victims of intensified bombings.
